active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the advantages and limitations of heat maps versus other visualization techniques (e.g., bar charts or network graphs) for prioritizing TTPs in threat hunting. Provide real-world examples from tools like ATT&CK Navigator and support your arguments with evidence from MITRE ATT&CK observations.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert educational flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity pedagogy, using Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, and scaffolding for optimal retention. Topic: Heat Map Analysis (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > 011_Threat Hunting > 006_Analytical Techniques and Methods > Visualization Techniques > Heat Map Analysis). Use this synthesized content: [Insert full scaffolding content here, including completed color coding (Dark Red: Very High; Red: High; Orange: Medium; Yellow: Low; White/Gray: No observed activity), tools (ATT&CK Navigator, Recorded Future), big picture (prioritizes TTPs in hunting workflows), prerequisites, and research definitions from MITRE ATT&CK (Tactics/Techniques/Sub-techniques/Procedures, matrices: Enterprise/ICS/etc.)]. Voter consensus: 100% approval on completeness (full color schemes), pedagogy (objectives/layers), big picture. Learning Objectives: [paste array]. Active Learning: [reference activities for flashcard tie-ins, e.g., cards prompting discussion-style analysis]. Scaffolding: [paste layers]. Generate 80 flashcards exactly matching the schema: {id, question, type, answer, options (array for MCQ), explanation (with rationale, misconceptions, refs, Bloom's level, layer), tags}. Balance: 20 per layer, span all objectives (2+ per level). 60% MCQ with distractors per protocol. Ensure university-level: active recall, spaced repetition friendly. Output ONLY a JSON array of objects, no extra text.
